intro: Thesium gnidiaceum var. zeyheri, commonly known as the Zeyher's thesium, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae. It is characterized by its erect, herbaceous stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in dense, spike-like inflorescences. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in sandy or rocky soils. Thesium gnidiaceum var. zeyheri is often found in open vegetation and is adapted to arid or semi-arid conditions.
